definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: More on that news conference by Chief Cabinet Secretary Yukio Edano.
sentences.chinese: 内阁官房长官枝野幸男在新闻发布会上还说了更多。

sentences.english: And Yasuhisa Shiozaki, a former chief cabinet secretary, has not accepted Mr Watanabe's entreaties to join him.
sentences.chinese: 前官房长官盐崎恭久也拒绝了渡边一同退党的要求。

sentences.english: Branch chief Yukio Ueno said at a press conference, "do not understand the relevant facts."
sentences.chinese: 官房长官枝野幸男在记者会上称“不了解相关事实”。

sentences.english: The chief cabinet secretary, Takeo Kawamura, insisted Nakagawa had not been drunk.
sentences.chinese: 内阁官房长官武雄河村坚持称中川没有喝醉。

sentences.english: Yoshito Sengoku, the chief cabinet secretary, will serve as justice minister until a permanent appointment is made.
sentences.chinese: 法务大臣一职将暂由内阁官房长官仙谷由人兼任。

sentences.english: Japan's Chief Cabinet Secretary Yukio Ueno branch position soon.
sentences.chinese: 日本内阁官房长官枝野幸男也很快表态。

sentences.english: Japan's Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshito Sengoku called for calm on both sides Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 星期二日本内阁官房长官仙谷由人呼吁双方保持冷静。

sentences.english: Yoshito Sengoku, the chief cabinet secretary, will serve as justiceminister until a permanent appointment is made.
sentences.chinese: 法务大臣一职将暂由内阁官房长官仙谷由人兼任。

definition: Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
foreign ministry (e.g. of Japan or Korea)
ASŌ Tarō (1940-), Japanese entrepreneur and LDP politician, prime minister from 2008
KOMURA Masahiko (1942-), Japanese politician, foreign minister from 1998, minister of defense from 2007
KAN Naoto (1946-), Japanese Democratic Party politician, prime minister 2010-2011
MORI Yoshirō (1937-), Japanese rugby player and politician, prime minister 2000-2001, famous for numerous gaffes
FUKUDA Yasuo (1936-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2007-2008
